reviews.review: One of the best games I have ever played, The animations may have not been the best, but the story, it all wrapped up. So amazing, I just wish they didn't shut down. I hope whoever takes the reins of these series will keep the legacy rolling

The screen fades in, and you find yourself sitting in a boat, with two twins bickering about you, what you do and don't do. The male twin hands you a box with a pistol, some ammunition, a cryptic message, and a picture of a young woman, before dropping you off at a lighthouse and rowing away. You decide to walk in the lighthouse, and climb your way to the lookout, where you see 3 bells. You ring them, opening up a door, revealing a seat in a small, condensed room. You take a seat, and are immediately thrown into the sky, higher and higher, until you're above the clouds, and find a city, just floating there.

You wander through a welcome center of sorts, and are forced into a Baptism before being allowed into the city. You wander for a short while, making your way into a carnival, and lucky you- you've just won the town lottery! Your prize? 

Throwing the first stone at the excecution of an interracial couple. But wait, your day gets better- Your right hand also has the markings of what the city's equivilent of the Antichrist. Oh, boy.

This is how BioShock Infinite starts, and the story only gets more interesting from there. The plot is quite a memorable one. Even though I finished the main story a month or so ago, I could probably tell you everything that happens. 

The gameplay is not the strongest, I personally liked BioShock 1's combat best (The dual-weilding of Vigors / weapons bothers me from a realism standpoint) , but it works well enough to not be too repetitive. Some of the guns, like the machine gun, seem to lack a bit of punch, but the Vigors make up for that by looking just as devestating as they should look. 

The setting is one of my favorites from any series, Columbia looks like people actually live there, and the political ideals of the citizens and government aren't over-the-top. Also, it's racist, and that's always fun. The world is quite deep, and everyone you pass seems to have something to say, having a conversation with their friends or family. 

The characters are top-notch. Booker DeWitt has a voice, something new in BioShock, and rarely seen in FPS games nowadays, it seems. Booker's a great character, but as you've probably heard, Elizebeth is the real star of the game. She's one of the best NPCs in video games since Alyx Vance from Half-Life 2.

Overall, BioShock Infinite is an absolutely fantastic game. But, I have to say, I think it's the weakest of the BioShock games. Make of that what you will.

I found the game to be extremely short in terms of playtime, only requiring 13 hours to complete it and I was trying to search for everything. But without a doubt, 13 hours well spent, the storyline is immersive, and the detail in the world is so beautiful it was almost distracting. Even that one jumpscare took me by surprise my headphones went flying off my head.

I love this game. I feel no need to comment on the narrative, world-building or aesthetic quality, because we all know those aspects are impeccable. There's been a lot of criticism of the gameplay, but as long as you steer clear of the basic repeater, the combat is dynamic, energetic and exciting, and I would heartily recommend this game to anyone. Easily my third favourite game after DOTA 2 and Infamous 2.

[b][u]Bioshock Infinite: Historically Coherent[/u][/b]

After just now completing [i]Bioshock Inifite[/i], I will describe it in one word: [i]brilliant[/i]. As plenty of others have said more than enough about it I will keep this review (relatively) brief.

As a history undergrad this game explores topics that I have an arguable understanding of and a genuine interest in. Throughout, the developers did an amazing job with the story, the setting, and the characterization. While clearly an alternative history narrative, the topics dealt with in [i]Bioshock Infinite[/i] were nonetheless historically [i]coherent[/i]. By this I mean that these topics were treated in a rigorous manner that did not depart from what we would expect, nor from what we have seen in (actual) history. In essence, Bioshock Infinite could be described as a fictional story but one which is based on true events.

Another aspect of the game that shown through was its attention to detail. In this regard, [i]Bioshock Infinite[/i] is second to none. As a comparative, [i]Deus Ex: Human Revolution[/i] is the only other game that may come close in this area. In a similar manner, of all the sequels I have played, [i]Bioshock Infinite[/i] is perhaps second only to [i]Portal 2[/i] in its apparent success of following a strong original game with an even stronger sequel. 

While this is the core of what I wanted to share about this game, below I will provide some tips for a more enjoyable experience (in response to some of the reviews that I have read here on Steam). Even further below that I will provide some arguably spoiler-level suggestions for a (perhaps) more successful experience in Colombia.

Ultimately, I strongly suggest that you consider purchasing and playing this game!

[b][u]Tips for an Enjoyable Experience[/u][/b]

[i]First[/i], follow the recommendations for choosing your difficulty at the start. If you play FPSs regularly, play at the hard difficulty. When in doubt, err on the harder side and dial it down if your needs be.

[i]Second[/i], find a playstyle that you find enjoyable and rewarding. There is no point of playing the game by just spamming the skyhook system if you do not enjoy that. I sniped, ran the carbine, and the blaster. I used the [spoiler]crow and shield[/spoiler] vigors. And, despite being very consistent in my loadout, I enjoyed the combat and found it to be relatively challenging throughout. I especially found the finale challenging. By the end of the game I had died about fifteen to twenty times total, and I accrued two-thirds of those deaths in the finale itself ([spoiler]my chosen loadout was not very effective in this situation). Ammo could indeed be a problem for me considering the combination of my loadout and difficulty, and yes, this was even despite Liz's help.[/spoiler]

[i]Third[/i], yes there are facets that I could nitpick, but in the end none of them stood out to me. All were drown out by the story, the setting, and the characters. All of these facets were never annoying enough to cause me to become frustrated with the game during. None of them now spring to mind in hindsight after having had the pleasure of the conclusion. In other words, I enjoyed the ride and the bumps did not detract enough to merit a concern.

[i]Fourth[/i], despite having correctly guessed many of the aspects of the story and characters I still enjoyed it: beginning, middle, and end. The execution was well done; I configured the game to my taste, and took my time. The immersive elements of the game were well polished by default and I further improved it by disabling all the silly little helper prompts that I could. As such, I spent my time thoroughly exploring each area and taking in the game as it was. Each revelation or confirmation was a piece of the puzzle that I had hunted down and found. It was not just handed to me. 

[b][u]Possible Spoiler-Level Suggestions for Success[/u][/b]
[spoiler][i]First[/i], fully upgrade either the shotgun, the machine gun, or the pistol. These weapons are ubiquitous throughout the game and can provide for useful backups when your preferred weapons are rundown.

[i]Second[/i], purchase lockpicks! Anytime you see these buy them (and do so from the start). It is trivial to open areas that are locked if you have the picks but it is nearly impossible or can be time consuming if you must go backwards (if even possible) and retrieve them. The cost of lockpicks is insignificant in the greater context of the game.

[i]Third[/i], concentrate your upgrades. Even if playing in a completionist manner, there does not seem to be enough money to upgrade all weapons and all vigors. I only managed to upgrade a few of the weapons completely and only a couple of the vigors before the game was over. While this improves replay value, unless you are playing an intentional generalist, consider specializing in one of the weapons I suggest above, plus a favorite, and then a couple vigors that you really enjoy and that seem effective.[/spoiler]
amazing

If you like beautiful graphics, unweaving a complicated storyline, and playing FPS games, this is probably worth getting. The world-building is fantastic and it has plenty of striking moments that will stay with you long after.

It is not without problems, however.
1. The story does not weave very well with the gameplay. There are a lot of immersion-breaking mechanics and story twists that are never really explained
2. The game has a respawn mechanic that I find utterly infuriating. If you're the kind of FPS player who likes saving before big a fight and repeatedly trying until you beat it in one go, you probably will hate it too. The game's checkpoint/respawn system makes that style of play highly impractical
3. The level design occassionally suffers from implausible barriers and invisible walls
4. The game has the largest difficulty spike I have ever encountered in a videogame. I found out afterwards that many players had to lower the difficulty on that one section in order to progress
5. The game's "sky-rail" mechanic is really fun, but of all the firefights I can only recall a handful where the level was large and varied enough to really take advantage of it

Es lohnt sich, das Spiel mindestens 1x durch zu zocken. Meines Erachtens hat es eine Super Story, da in der fortlaufenden Handlung bis zum bitteren Ende gekämpft werden muss und Geheim gehalten wird, warum man Elizabeth befreit. Mit dem Stil des Jahres 1912 sind die Waffen simpel gehalten und gut vermischt mit der Magie von Bioshock. Die Stadt ist etwas "linear" gehalten, aber es gibt dennoch genug zu entdecken.
Ich empfehle, das Spiel auf mindestens Normal-Schwierigkeit zu spielen, um eine gewisse Anforderung zu haben, was das Spiel nicht langweilig macht!

Hab mir das Spiel im Bundle mit Bioshock und Bioshock 2 geholt. Es hat sich gelohnt, fantastische Spielwelt, ruckelfreies Spiel, erstklassige Story und natürlich Elizabeth^^. Allein die ersten Minuten in Columbia waren fantastisch...ich wollte garnicht weiterspielen weil mir die Steampunk-artige Welt so gefallen hat. Im Weiteren Verlauf standen dann die Kämpfe an den Skylines an. Dachte erst das es schwer wird aber man hat den Dreh schnell raus. Schade dass man nur 2 Waffen gleichzeitig dabei haben kann, ein Unterschied zu den Vorgängern. Man braucht eine Weile um die passende Waffe zu finden. Die Kräfte sind wie üblich bei Bioshock innovativ und vor allem bestens in Szene gesetzt. Dein Begleiter unterstützt dich im Kampf mit Munition, Heilung und Salzen für die Kräfte, dennoch bleiben die Kämpfe vor allem in der 2. Hälfte des Spiels anspruchsvoll. Der Story zu folgen wurde  zeitweise schwierig mit den ganzen Zeitlinien und vor allem das Ende war für mich etwas verwirrend. Alles in allem aber ein klasse Spiel das sich nicht hinter seinen Vorgängern verstecken muss.^^

Awesome game! Combat and game mechanics might be slightly dumbed down compared to previous "-shock games", but only in a way that it is just the more fun to play. The skyhooks are just great and the game flow is challenging (to me at least and in highest difficulty) but never frustrating. But forget all this, the thing you are actually getting here is far more than a simple shooter - this is pure literature. There are so many mindblowing topics to this intricately told parable, ranging from history, art, pop culture, natural science and just great drama - if you are in for one of the most grown up, sophisticated stories ever told by a fps, get this game now.

If you do play this then make sure to pay full attention otherwise you will get confused. Great game!

BioShock Infinite, für mich ein super Spiel welches ich, wenn auch auf leicht durchspielen konnte.
Die stimmungsvolle Grafik und Story machen diesen Ego Shooter für mich zu etwas Besonderes, die Steuerung / Bedienung ist nicht unfair und man wird sehr gut im Spiel geleitet.
Die  Spielzeit könnte etwas länger sein, natürlich gibt die Möglichkeit es noch auf normal und schwer zu spielen, doch bei meiner Hand Augen Koordination kann ich das vergessen und natürlich sind da noch die DLCs, schade finde ich nur dass die DLCs nicht auf Deutsch vertont wurden, Deutsche Untertitel gleichen das leider nicht aus (kann kein Englisch).

Ich kann es sehr empfehlen.

Das Gameplay ist nichts besonderes, eine stark beschleunigte Version von den bisherigen BioShock spielen mit ein paar neuen Sachen. Macht durchaus Spaß. Was die Story angeht streiten die geister. Ich finde die geschichte des Hauptspiels sehr gut, wenn auch teilweise etwas kompliziert. Ich will hier nicht mehr vor weg nehmen, man sollte unvoreingenommen dran gehen.

Was die DLCs angeht, so kann ich diese nur bedingt empfehlen. Das Gemeplay des ersten Burial at Sea ist identisch zu dem des Hauptspieles und wäre für den Vollpreis schlicht zu teuer gewesen. Das zweite DLC wiederum war vom Gameplay wirklich interessen, da die schnellen Mechaniken perfekt in ein Stealth-Spiel umgearbeitet wurden. Auch die länge ist hier für den Preis vollkommen angemessen und die Geschichte als solche ist toll. Allerdings finde ich das Ende entäuschend. Es passt ein einigen Ecken und Enden einfach nicht zusammen.

Not often you can find a FPS with a so deep, rich and mind-blowing story such as this one. It's like watching an absolutely amazing movie (both visually and in terms of storytelling and ambientation) while shooting stuff, using really cool powers (a.k.a. vigors) and collecting pineapples from dead bodies. Perhaps not a long game or a very challenging one in terms of difficulty (at least in medium) but definitely worth it because of the characters and the circumstances they found themselves in. And because of the pineapples.
Overrated with boring gunplay and 2deep4u story, looks pretty though

With a much looser story that meanders around before screeching to a halt, sloppy PC porting issues, and unentertaining combat, Bioshock Infinite doesn't hold a candle to either System Shock 2 or the first Bioshock. Those two games presented tight mysteries that were all explained in-universe during the course of the game (e.g., The Many, Dr. Polito, the Big Daddies, the plasmids, Would You Kindly, etc.), whereas Bioshock Infinite expects players to take its magic powers and huge flying supercreatures (Songbird) for granted, with no attempt whatsoever to justify them in-universe, and only a feeble half-attempt at explaining the "tears" system.

The combat AI is a joke, with lame "can't find him!" mechanics that don't work well, and headshots are easily attained on oblivious enemies even in the final battles of the game. The only time things get even remotely hairy is when the game forces the gimmick of defending a destroyable objective upon you.

Whoever decided to put a constant, grating, looping "shk-shk" noise on the vaunted PC options menu -- whose maximum FOV option is still less than PC FPS enthusiasts expect -- should be taken to a sound stage and have a subwoofer rammed up their nether regions. And there are bugs, too -- after a major boss fight, a cinematic sequence screwed up and the game couldn't proceed, leading me to replay that aggravating sequence. All over, audio crackles and pops from channel overload.

Yes, Elizabeth is very well voice-acted and she is a better companion than most games foist upon the player. The "Heavy Hitter" bosses were massively oversold in the pre-release hype, being mostly Guys With Big Guns And Tons Of HP, and little else to recommend them. Some of these characters only show up one or two times, which is disappointing on the one hand as they do tend to spice up combat, but relieving on the other hand as it's almost as boring to shoot them as it is to shoot everybody else, and some of their gimmicks are downright annoying. The first time you fight a Handyman, ask yourself: if my screen is shaking so much from him just walking around on the other side of the arena, how the hell are any of the buildings still standing intact? The answer is: because the guy who decided the "cinematic screen shake" effect had to go in didn't give two hoots about your ability to aim, enjoy the fight, or any pretense of fictional integrity. 

With unsatisfying combat and upgrades that feel like they don't matter, characters that spout convoluted psychobabble to no purpose, and an unsatisfying story that doesn't answer anything -- the big reveal at the very end, for example, only begs the question of "OK, yes, I recognized the foreshadowing of this, but WHY is this the case?" -- overall, there's little to recommend the game besides the occasionally striking visuals of nostalgic early 20th century Americana.

It's a shame that the older games don't hold up too well visually, and have trouble running on modern PCs, because Ken Levine is riding the coattails of those far greater accomplishments.

This game here... Is more than just a game. It's an emotional journey through the lives of Booker DeWitt and a lovely woman named Elizabeth. Never have I been more attached to any characters than the ones is this game. And the expansions only add even more... They are the real link between this game and the first. I highly suggest that you get them. Get the "game" and discover what I truly mean...

Bioshock Infinite is the weaker cousin to its predecessors. The storyline is fairly predictable and the so-called political commentary was a 2D affair. At bottom, this game is okay but it isn't very fun. You are better off buying Bioshock 1 and 2 and System Shock 2. Skip this one even if it is on sale and save the disappointment.

Одна из лучших игр которых я  встречал.Третье дополнение конечно немного странновато в нём больше сюжета чем геймплея, но это всего лишь моё мнение. Финал конечно счастливый в Биошоке причём во всех дополнениях )))

Я не поклонник шутанов и других глупых пострелушек, но эта игра это что-то. Впервые за долгоеое время я прочувствовал все переживания главного героя, я проникся сюжетом. Думал что вжится в роль персонажа игры это не реально, но я ошибся...

   С первых минут игры, когда я сел на тот "знаменитый стул"... когда попал в Колумбию... Я был поражён. Такого я  ещё не видел. Irrational Games удалось создать идеальный летающий город. Эти парящие острова завораживают с первого взгляда. Всё вокруг такое необычное и прекрассное, что забываешь об остальных делах ИРЛ и просто залипаешь. Бегаешь, смотришь в телескопы, роешься в мусорниках, изучаешь мир вокруг.
  
   Как шутер, игра довольно неплоха. Главное что постоянно есть оружие в руках, патроны валяются на кажом шагу, дропаются с мобов, а так же наш божественный НПС_суппорт может подкинуть парочку если не хватает. Элизабет это вообще отдельная тема.

   Элизабет это универсальный помощник. Когда мало хп, она подкинет аптечку, когда нету маны, она даст нам фласку, когда кончаются патроны...Вуаля, и они у вас уже есть.  Сама Элизабет очень хороша. Мало того что персонаж внешне ну уж очень риятен, так ещё и не метается под ногами во время побоищ. Когда бегаешь по спокойным локациям интерестно наблюдать за нею. Она может рассматривать всякие предметы в витринах, или же стоять оперевшись о бочку рассматривая всё вокруг. Даже помогает иногда находить предметы, отмычки например.

Очень порадовала сюжетная составляющая. Сюжет это наверное одно из самых сильных мест игры...Нет. Это самое сильное её место. Всё очень запутано, ну уж очень... Но это же круто. После прохождения самой игры я ещё где-то пол часа обдумывал произошедшее. Я до сих пор не уверен что осознал всё. Но одно я понял точно - время что я потратил на игру, потрачено не зря.


Irrational Games умеют делать шедевры.

One of the most surprising and genuinely enjoyable gaming experiences I've had in some time.  I had read the reviews, even seen some of the gameplay before, yet nothing prepared me for the sheer awesome that is this game.  

You get tossed nto a world of mystery and madness where the dizzying heights the game takes you to keeps you on your toes more than any survival horror game ever did for me (and I've played many -- it's one of my favorite genres).  

This isn't a survival horror game, nor is it a proper FPS game. It's something new, bright, refreshing (albeit a uear old; I'm late to the party), artistic and truly awesome.  Highly recommended.

알찬 내용과 화사한 그래픽 그리고 최적화 여러모로 참 좋지만...약간 메롱한 한글화가 아쉬운건 어쩔수 없네요

Jedna z najlepszych gier wszechczasów. Rozgrywka jest bardzo miodna, a starcia z przeciwnikami są przerywane spokojnym zwiedzaniem Kolumbii i dialogami z naszą pomocnicą. Niektórym (szczególnie fanom mrocznych i ciemnych Bioshock 1/2) może nie spodobać się ten kolorowy i cukierkowy świat, jednak jest to tylko przykrywka do niezwykle wciągającej fabuły. Fabuły, która nie pozwala nam odejść od ekranu. I gdy już wiemy, o co tak naprawdę chodzi, BioShock Infinite nas zaskakuje. A potem drugi raz. I następny... Tytuł, w który trzeba zagrać.
Brutal of Sea - История о том, как вмеми нами любимая Элизабет погибнет. Я ожидал хорошего конца. Я разочарован. только 360 рублей на ветер.
A mediocre shooter, with unneeded powers. The powers just slowed me down. The game really only shines in its story.

Absolutely fantastic piece of art. Look no further to prove to the world that video games have mature entries that can make the player think, even after the end of the game. Highly recommend it to amateur and hardcore players, as well as skeptics of modern video games.

Gun action is not as intuitive as I had hoped, but it serves its purpose. Vigors are especially fun to mix and match to fit your gameplay style.

Story is THE main highlight of the whole game. Do not miss out on the exposition lying around the entire journey!

Wow what an amazing game! i truly do not hand out perfect scores to any games but if its achievable, this game is just that!
its well rounded, stunningly detailed and has a surprising and engaging storyline with wonderful characters:)

I delayed playing the game for a while... not sure why I just thought it didnt look Bioshock-y enough. but when I played it boy oh boy was I wrong.

This game has an amazing story and an amazing gameplay buy it and dont think twice, best of all the bioshock series so far.

Эта игра действительно стоющая.В ней просто всё прекрасно , особенно меня порадовала система боя . Яркие краски недают вам оторваться от игры . Элизабет великолепна. Я советую вам Bioshock Inf, вы не пожалеете!!!)

Bioshock Infinite is an amazing game that gives alot of potential and an amazing FPS (first person shooter) that will have anybody at the edge of their seats. This game I would recommend to anybody that loves the Bioshock series and has a taste for the intense FPS that the game has to offer. Bioshock is a must have and is worth every penny.
